string.name: asus_phone_info_label
string.description: The title of the activity to see phone info

string.name: asus_roaming_warning_multiuser
string.description: mobile network settings screen, message in dialog box that appears when you select the Data roaming check box. This is for multiuser tablets

resources.string: When you allow data roaming, you may incur significant roaming charges!\n\nThis setting affects all users on this handheld mobile device.

string.name: asus_crypt_keeper_encrypt_title
string.description: Title of the preferences item to control encryption

string.name: asus_crypt_keeper_desc
string.description: Informational text in the first confirmation screen before starting device encryption

resources.string: You can encrypt your accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media, and other files. After you encrypt your device, assuming you\'ve set up a screen lock(that is, a pattern or numeric PIN or password), you\'ll need to unlock the screen to decrypt the device every time you power it on. The only other way to decrypt is to perform a factory data reset, erasing all your data.\n\nEncryption takes an hour or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your device plugged in throughout the process. If you interrupt it, you\'ll lose some or all of your data

string.name: asus_crypt_keeper_button_text
string.description: Button text to start encryption process

string.name: asus_crypt_keeper_final_desc
string.description: Warning text in the final confirmation screen before starting device encryption

resources.string: The encryption operation is irreversible and if you interrupt it, you\'ll lose data. Encryption takes an hour or more, during which the device will restart several times.

string.name: asus_crypt_keeper_setup_description
string.description: Informational text on the progress screen while encrypting the device

resources.string: Wait while your device is being encrypted. ^1% complete.

string.name: asus_crypt_keeper_setup_time_remaining
string.description: Informational text on the progress screen while encrypting the device

resources.string: Wait while your device is being encrypted. Time remaining: ^1

string.name: asus_crypt_keeper_failed_summary
string.description: Informational text when encryption fails

resources.string: Encryption was interrupted and can\'t complete. As a result, the data on your device is no longer accessible. \n\n To resume using your device, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your device after the reset, you\'ll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account.

string.name: asus_crypt_keeper_data_corrupt_summary
string.description: Informational text when encryption fails

resources.string: The password you entered is correct, but unfortunately your data is corrupt. \n\nTo resume using your device, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your device after the reset, you\'ll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account.

string.name: asus_bluetooth_disconnect_pan_nap_profile
string.description: Bluetooth settings. Message for disconnecting from the PAN profile (NAP role).

resources.string: %1$s will be disconnected from sharing this device\'s Internet connection.

string.description: Description of NFC in the 1st level settings screen, for a tablet.

resources.string: Allow data exchange when the device touches another device

string.name: asus_wifi_skipped_message
string.description: Text warning about skipping Wi-Fi with a mobile connect

resources.string: WARNING: if you skip Wi\u2011Fi, your device will only use cellular data for initial downloads and updates. To avoid possible data charges, connect to Wi\u2011Fi.

string.name: asus_wifi_and_mobile_skipped_message
string.description: Text warning about skipping Wi-Fi without a mobile connect

resources.string: WARNING: If you skip Wi\u2011Fi, your device won\'t have an Internet connection to use for any initial downloads or updates.
The device was unable to connect to this Wi\u2011Fi network.

Your Google account

System and app data and settings

Downloaded apps"

string.name: asus_install_all_warning
string.description: Applications settings screen, message text of alert that appears if user selects the Unknown sources check box

resources.string: Your device and personal data are more vulnerable to attack by apps from unknown sources. You agree that you are solely responsible for any damage to your device or loss of data that may result from using these apps.

string.description: Manage applications, individual application info screen, text that appears under the Permissions heading. This describes the permissions that the application has.

resources.string: This app can access the following on your device:

string.name: asus_security_settings_desc_multi
string.description: Manage applications, individual application info screen, text that appears under the Permissions heading. This describes the permissions that the application has. It is used when multiple packages are contributing to the permissions and need to be listed here.

resources.string: This app can access the following on your device.

resources.string: If you stop this service, some features of your device may stop working correctly until you power it off and then on again.

resources.string: Removing this account will delete all of its messages, contacts, and other data from the device!

string.name: asus_data_usage_auto_sync_on_dialog
string.description: Title of dialog shown when user enables global auto sync

resources.string: Any changes you make to your accounts on the web will be automatically copied to your device.\n\nSome accounts may also automatically copy any changes you make on the device to the web. A Google Account works this way.

string.name: asus_data_usage_limit_dialog_mobile
string.description: Body of dialog shown before user limits mobile data usage

resources.string: Your device will turn off cellular data once it reaches the limit you set.\n\nSince data usage is measured by your device, and your carrier may account for usage differently, consider setting a conservative limit.
If you restrict background cellular data, some apps and services won\'t work unless you\'re connected to Wi\u2011Fi.\n\nThis setting affects all users on this device.

string.name: asus_data_usage_total_during_range_mobile
string.description: Label displaying total network data transferred during a specific time period, including a disclaimer that contrasts device versus carrier reporting

resources.string: %2$s: about %1$s used, as measured by your device. Your carrier\'s data usage accounting may differ.

string.name: asus_user_cannot_manage_message
string.description: Message to secondary users that only owner can manage users

resources.string: Only the device\'s owner can manage users.

string.name: asus_user_confirm_remove_self_message
string.description: User (self) removal confirmation message

resources.string: You will lose your space and data on this device. You can\'t undo this action.

string.name: asus_global_change_warning
string.description: Warning message when changing a global setting for a table

resources.string: This setting affects all users on this device.

string.description: Restrictions summary for allowing NFC transfers

resources.string: Allow data exchange when the device touches another device

string.name: asus_location_mode_sensors_only_title
string.description: Location settings screen, GPS only location mode

string.name: asus_screen_pinning_description
string.description: Screen pinning description

resources.string:
When turned on, you can use screen pinning to keep the current screen in view until you unpin.

To use screen pinning:

1. Make sure screen pinning is turned on.

2. Open the screen you want to pin.

3. Tap recent apps key.

4. Tap the pin icon.
Screen is off, double tap to wake. From swipe locked screen, double tap empty space to turn screen off. From status bar and launcher, double tap empty space to turn screen off.
Double tap to wakeup/\ndouble tap to suspend
Double tap to wakeup/"\n"Double tap to suspend
At lock screen with swipe to unlock, double tap on empty space to turn off screen. At status bar and launcher, double tap the empty space to turn off screen.
As screen is off, double tap at the same place on screen to wake up screen.
When using an app, shake twice to take a screenshot, and create a new task in Do It Later.
Hold phone in portrait mode, and lift to touch the ear.
While the phone in hands or pocket, phone knows you’re walking or in moving.
"Screen is off. Draw “C” to launch app."
"When a call arrives, double tap on phone body to select silent mode."
"Screen is off, Draw “e” to launch app."
"During an incoming call, flip device upside down to select silent mode. During media playback, flip device upside down to pause player."
"During media playback, flip the device upside up to pause player."
"Lift the phone to your ear to answer a call automatically without tapping the screen."
"During an incoming call, volume up ringtone while walking or moving."
"Screen is off. Draw “S” to launch app."
"Screen is off. Draw “V” to launch app."
"Screen is off. Draw “W” to launch app."
"Screen is off. Draw “Z” to launch app."
Allow file transfer using computers which you trust when connected.
